questions.text: A young female presents with acute abdominal pain and history of 1½ months amenorrhoea, on USG examination there is collection of fluid in the pouch of douglas and empty gestational sac seen in the adnexa. Diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ectopic Pregnancy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a young woman with acute abdominal pain, amenorrhea, and ultrasound findings of an empty gestational sac and fluid collection in the pouch of Douglas, an ectopic pregnancy should be highly suspected. This condition is a gynecological emergency requiring prompt diagnosis and management to prevent potentially life-threatening complications.
  • ➤ In a young woman with acute abdominal pain, amenorrhea, and ultrasound findings of an empty gestational sac and fluid collection in the pouch of Douglas, an ectopic pregnancy should be highly suspected.
  • ➤ This condition is a gynecological emergency requiring prompt diagnosis and management to prevent potentially life-threatening complications.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presents to the emergency department with neck pain and limited range of motion following a minor car accident. Radiologic examination reveals an abnormality in the apical ligament of the dens. This ligament is embryologically derived from which of the following structures?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Notochord

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The apical ligament of the dens is a derivative of the notochord . The notochord is an embryonic structure that provides signals for the development of the vertebral column and eventually forms the nucleus pulposus of intervertebral discs . The apical ligament of the dens represents a remnant of the notochord .
  • ➤ The apical ligament of the dens is a derivative of the notochord .
  • ➤ apical ligament
  • ➤ dens
  • ➤ notochord
  • ➤ The notochord is an embryonic structure that provides signals for the development of the vertebral column and eventually forms the nucleus pulposus of intervertebral discs .
  • ➤ embryonic structure
  • ➤ signals
  • ➤ development
  • ➤ vertebral column
  • ➤ nucleus pulposus
  • ➤ intervertebral discs
  • ➤ The apical ligament of the dens represents a remnant of the notochord .
  • ➤ apical ligament
  • ➤ dens
  • ➤ remnant
  • ➤ notochord

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the paediatrician’s office for a routine check-up. His mother reports that he enjoys playing with other children and is good at communication. Which of the following developmental milestones is most concerning if not achieved by this child?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ By 3 years of age, children should be able to use a spoon effectively to feed themselves.
  • ➤ By 3 years of age, children should be able to use a spoon effectively to feed themselves.

questions.text: In the context of Indian courts, which type of evidence is usually prioritized by the judiciary in making decisions?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Oral Evidence

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Exception to oral evidence (where document alone is acceptable):
  • ➤ Exception to oral evidence (where document alone is acceptable):
  • ➤ Exception to oral evidence (where document alone is acceptable):
  • ➤ Dying declaration Expert opinions expressed in a book Deposition of a medical witness taken in a lower court Evidence given by a witness in a previous judicial proceeding Statements by persons who cannot be called as itnesses: e.g. dead, untraceable etc. Report of certain government scientific experts: Chemical Examiner Chief Controller of Explosives, Director of Fingerprint Bureau, Director of a Central Forensic Science Laboratory
  • ➤ Dying declaration
  • ➤ Expert opinions expressed in a book
  • ➤ Deposition of a medical witness taken in a lower court
  • ➤ Evidence given by a witness in a previous judicial proceeding
  • ➤ Statements by persons who cannot be called as itnesses: e.g. dead, untraceable etc.
  • ➤ Report of certain government scientific experts: Chemical Examiner Chief Controller of Explosives, Director of Fingerprint Bureau, Director of a Central Forensic Science Laboratory
  • ➤ Chemical Examiner Chief Controller of Explosives, Director of Fingerprint Bureau, Director of a Central Forensic Science Laboratory
  • ➤ Chemical Examiner
  • ➤ Chief Controller of Explosives,
  • ➤ Director of Fingerprint Bureau,

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman with 20 weeks pregnancy presents with bleeding per vaginum. On speculum examination, the os is open but no products have come out. The diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ The presentation of vaginal bleeding, cramping, and an open cervical os without the passage of any pregnancy tissues at 20 weeks of gestation is indicative of an inevitable abortion, where the miscarriage process is irreversible but not yet complete.
  • ➤ The presentation of vaginal bleeding, cramping, and an open cervical os without the passage of any pregnancy tissues at 20 weeks of gestation is indicative of an inevitable abortion, where the miscarriage process is irreversible but not yet complete.

questions.text: During an equipment check on an anesthesia machine, you are tasked with identifying and understanding the function of various components within the intermediate pressure system. Which of the following is a component of this system?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Diameter index safety system

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Diameter index safety system is a component of the intermediate pressure system of an anesthesia machine, which is designed to ensure that gas-specific hoses are connected to the correct gas pipeline supply outlets.
  • ➤ Diameter index safety system is a component of the intermediate pressure system of an anesthesia machine, which is designed to ensure that gas-specific hoses are connected to the correct gas pipeline supply outlets.

questions.text: A 65-year-old female patient presents with gradual, progressive visual field loss in both eyes. Examination reveals increased intraocular pressure, cupping of the optic disc, and visual field testing shows arcuate scotoma. Which cell type in the retina is primarily affected in this patient's condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ganglion cells

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Glaucomatous optic atrophy primarily affects retinal ganglion cells, leading to their apoptosis and resulting in progressive optic nerve changes and visual field defects.
  • ➤ Glaucomatous optic atrophy primarily affects retinal ganglion cells, leading to their apoptosis and resulting in progressive optic nerve changes and visual field defects.

questions.text: Which of the following steps has proven benefit in decreasing puerperal infection following cesarean section:

options.label: C
options.text: Administration of single dose of ampicillin or 1st generation cephalosporin at the time of cesarean delivery.

options.label: D
options.text: Skin closure with staples than with suture

questions.correct_answer: C. Administration of single dose of ampicillin or 1st generation cephalosporin at the time of cesarean delivery.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Administration of single dose of ampicillin or 1st generation cephalosporin at the time of cesarean delivery.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The administration of a single dose of prophylactic antibiotics, such as ampicillin or a first-generation cephalosporin, at the time of cesarean delivery is a proven strategy to decrease the risk of puerperal infections, aligning with evidence-based recommendations to enhance postoperative outcomes and maternal health.
  • ➤ The administration of a single dose of prophylactic antibiotics, such as ampicillin or a first-generation cephalosporin, at the time of cesarean delivery is a proven strategy to decrease the risk of puerperal infections, aligning with evidence-based recommendations to enhance postoperative outcomes and maternal health.

questions.text: In the laboratory setting, researchers are employing various serological tests to distinguish between different rickettsial species. The Weil-Felix reaction, historically known as the Neil Mosser reaction, is utilized for this purpose. Which of the following pairs of Rickettsiae species can be differentiated using the Weil-Felix reaction?
questions.correct_answer: A. R. prowazekii and R. typhi
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neil mooser reaction is done to differentiate epidemic typhus R. prowazekii which gives a negative tunica reaction and endemic typhus (R. typhi) which gives a positive tunica reaction.
  • ➤ Neil mooser reaction is done to differentiate epidemic typhus R. prowazekii which gives a negative tunica reaction and endemic typhus (R. typhi) which gives a positive tunica reaction.

questions.text: An infertile couple is being evaluated for infertility. They are advised to take a post coital test. What is the purpose of this test?

options.label: A
options.text: To determine the viability of sperm

options.label: B
options.text: To assess the quality of cervical mucous

options.label: C
options.text: To evaluate the process of ovulation

questions.correct_answer: B. To assess the quality of cervical mucous
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) To assess the quality of cervical mucous

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The post-coital test is conducted to assess the interaction between sperm and cervical mucous following intercourse, specifically looking at how well sperm can survive and move within the cervical mucous. This test helps to identify potential issues with cervical mucous that might impede sperm movement or survival, which could contribute to infertility.
  • ➤ The post-coital test is conducted to assess the interaction between sperm and cervical mucous following intercourse, specifically looking at how well sperm can survive and move within the cervical mucous.
  • ➤ This test helps to identify potential issues with cervical mucous that might impede sperm movement or survival, which could contribute to infertility.

questions.text: In the procedure depicted, methylene blue is being injected peri-tumorally. This method is commonly used in which of the following surgical procedures for breast carcinoma?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sentinel lymph node biopsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The sentinel lymph node biopsy is performed using a dual tracer method to identify the first lymph node(s) draining the area of a primary tumor in breast carcinoma, aiding in the assessment of cancer spread.
  • ➤ The sentinel lymph node biopsy is performed using a dual tracer method to identify the first lymph node(s) draining the area of a primary tumor in breast carcinoma, aiding in the assessment of cancer spread.

questions.text: Which type of pelvis is associated with increased incidence of ‘face to pubis’ delivery?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Anthropoid pelvis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The anthropoid pelvis, with its oval shape and longer anteroposterior diameter, can be associated with an increased incidence of "face to pubis" deliveries due to the way it may affect fetal head engagement and presentation during labor.
  • ➤ The anthropoid pelvis, with its oval shape and longer anteroposterior diameter, can be associated with an increased incidence of "face to pubis" deliveries due to the way it may affect fetal head engagement and presentation during labor.

questions.text: A 40-year-old male presented with a recurrent history of vesiculopustular macerated plaques over the axilla as shown in the image below. Which of the following statements is TRUE about the disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Defect is in Calcium Pump ATP 2A2 Gene

options.label: C
options.text: Nails have Red & White Longitudinal Bands

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Histopathology Reveals Incomplete Acantholysis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hailey-Hailey disease is characterized by recurrent vesiculopustular lesions, particularly in areas of friction such as the axillae, with histopathological findings of incomplete acantholysis.
  • ➤ Hailey-Hailey disease is characterized by recurrent vesiculopustular lesions, particularly in areas of friction such as the axillae, with histopathological findings of incomplete acantholysis.

questions.text: A new-born is noted to have jaundice on the first day of life. The mother's blood type is O positive, and there are no signs of infection. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial management?

options.label: A
options.text: Observe only as it is mostly physiological jaundice

options.label: C
options.text: Liver function tests and liver biopsy as it is mostly due to cholestasis

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Phototherapy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neonatal jaundice presenting on the first day of life generally requires intervention with phototherapy, especially if related to non-hemolytic causes, as early treatment can prevent the development of severe hyperbilirubinemia and kernicterus.
  • ➤ Neonatal jaundice presenting on the first day of life generally requires intervention with phototherapy, especially if related to non-hemolytic causes, as early treatment can prevent the development of severe hyperbilirubinemia and kernicterus.

questions.text: Which of the following features indicates the presence of heart disease in pregnancy and which is not seen in normal pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Distended neck veins is a clinical feature that indicates the presence of heart disease in pregnancy and is not normally seen in healthy pregnant women.
  • ➤ Distended neck veins is a clinical feature that indicates the presence of heart disease in pregnancy and is not normally seen in healthy pregnant women.

questions.text: A 22-year-old male present with bony mass in the metaphyseal region of right knee with typical sun ray appearance and CT Scan of the chest reveals osteoblastic metastases. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "sun ray" appearance on imaging, combined with the presence of osteoblastic metastases in the lungs and location in the metaphyseal region of the knee, strongly suggests a diagnosis of osteosarcoma.
  • ➤ The "sun ray" appearance on imaging, combined with the presence of osteoblastic metastases in the lungs and location in the metaphyseal region of the knee, strongly suggests a diagnosis of osteosarcoma.

questions.text: A 56-year-old male presents to the emergency with abdominal pain and an episode of binge drinking, in shock with a BP of 70/50 mm Hg and HR of 115/min. The oxygen saturation of the patient is 70 mm Hg. The serum creatinine level was 2.4 mg/dL. The patient has a serum lipase of 400. What is the likely diagnosis based on the CT image shown below?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Severe acute pancreatitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ The combination of clinical signs of shock, history of alcohol misuse, elevated creatinine and lipase, along with CT findings of extensive pancreatic necrosis, indicates severe acute pancreatitis with organ failure.
  • ➤ The combination of clinical signs of shock, history of alcohol misuse, elevated creatinine and lipase, along with CT findings of extensive pancreatic necrosis, indicates severe acute pancreatitis with organ failure.

questions.text: An elderly multiparous woman with intrauterine foetal death was admitted with strong labour pains. The patient suddenly goes in shock with cyanosis respiratory disturbances and pulmonary oedema. The most likely clinical diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Amniotic fluid embolism is a potential cause of sudden onset shock, cyanosis, respiratory disturbances, and pulmonary edema in a pregnant woman during labor, especially in the context of intrauterine fetal death.
  • ➤ Amniotic fluid embolism is a potential cause of sudden onset shock, cyanosis, respiratory disturbances, and pulmonary edema in a pregnant woman during labor, especially in the context of intrauterine fetal death.

questions.text: A medical resident is participating in a forensic rotation and is presented with a challenging task. The resident needs to analyze a degraded blood sample collected from an old crime scene to confirm the presence of hemoglobin. Given the sample's condition, it's crucial to use a forensic test that can provide specific microscopic evidence to ensure the result's accuracy. The resident must select the most appropriate test to observe the characteristic findings that would confirm haemoglobin’s presence. Which test should the medical resident utilize to observe the characteristic pink feathery crystals that confirm the presence of hemoglobin in the degraded blood sample?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Takayama test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Blood: Teichmann’s and Takayama test (Both are confirmatory tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Blood: Teichmann’s and Takayama test (Both are confirmatory tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Blood:
  • ➤ Teichmann’s - Brownish-black rhombic crystals of hematin chloride Takayama test - Pink feathery crystals of hemochromogen (reduced alkaline hematin)
  • ➤ Teichmann’s - Brownish-black rhombic crystals of hematin chloride
  • ➤ Takayama test - Pink feathery crystals of hemochromogen (reduced alkaline hematin)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Semen: Florence and Barberio test (Both are presumptive tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Semen: Florence and Barberio test (Both are presumptive tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Semen:
  • ➤ Florence test—For choline (dark brown rhombic crystals) Barberio test— detects spermine (yellow needle-shaped rhombic crystals)
  • ➤ Florence test—For choline (dark brown rhombic crystals)
  • ➤ Barberio test— detects spermine (yellow needle-shaped rhombic crystals)

questions.text: A 20-year-old patient is undergoing a surgical procedure under general anesthesia and is breathing spontaneously. Which breathing circuit should be used to facilitate spontaneous ventilation in this setting?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mapleson A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mapleson A (Magill circuit) is the breathing circuit of choice for patients who are undergoing general anesthesia and are spontaneously breathing, due to its efficient carbon dioxide clearance.
  • ➤ Mapleson A (Magill circuit) is the breathing circuit of choice for patients who are undergoing general anesthesia and are spontaneously breathing, due to its efficient carbon dioxide clearance.

questions.text: A 32-year-old pregnant woman with fibroid uterus develops acute pain in abdomen with low grade fever and mild leucocytosis at 28 weeks. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Red degeneration of fibroid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Red degeneration of fibroids is a likely cause of acute abdominal pain, low-grade fever, and mild leukocytosis in a pregnant woman with a known fibroid uterus.
  • ➤ Red degeneration of fibroids is a likely cause of acute abdominal pain, low-grade fever, and mild leukocytosis in a pregnant woman with a known fibroid uterus.

Example: Biceps brachii Pennate Arrangement: Muscle Fibers are obliquely oriented to the tendon , forming a feather-like pattern . Example: Rectus Femoris Cruciate Arrangement: Muscle fibres having 2 sets , which cross each other Example: Sternocleidomastoid Spiral/ Twisted: Muscle fibres having only 1 set in which upper fibres runs down & lower fibres runs upside in between attachments . Example: Latissimus Dorsi & Pectoralis Major

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with a 3-month history of progressive breathlessness and dyspnea was evaluated. A chest X-ray revealed a cavitary lesion in the lower lobe of the lung. A lobectomy was performed, and histopathological examination of the specimen produced the images shown. Based on these images, identify the infectious agent and the number of layers present in the cyst structure:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hydatid cyst - The cyst wall of hydatid cyst is bilayered (ectocyst and endocyst). There is also a host derived outer pericyst layer.
  • ➤ Hydatid cyst - The cyst wall of hydatid cyst is bilayered (ectocyst and endocyst). There is also a host derived outer pericyst layer.

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman para 6 delivers vaginally following normal labour with spontaneous delivery of an intact placenta. Excessive bleeding continues, despite manual exploration, bimanual massage, intravenous oxytocin and administration of 0.2 mg methergin IV, which one of the following would be the next step in the management of this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Injection of PGF 2α (Prostaglandin F2 alpha)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Injection of PGF 2α (Prostaglandin F2 alpha)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When managing a case of postpartum hemorrhage that is unresponsive to first-line interventions such as oxytocin and methergine, the next step should include considering the administration of PGF 2α due to its potent uterotonic effects, before proceeding to more invasive surgical options. This approach allows for the potential control of bleeding while preserving the uterus and fertility.
  • ➤ When managing a case of postpartum hemorrhage that is unresponsive to first-line interventions such as oxytocin and methergine, the next step should include considering the administration of PGF 2α due to its potent uterotonic effects, before proceeding to more invasive surgical options.
  • ➤ This approach allows for the potential control of bleeding while preserving the uterus and fertility.

questions.text: In uncemented arthroplasty of the hip, the stem remains attached to the bone by:

options.label: A
options.text: Bone Ingrowth/ overgrowth over the surface of the stem

options.label: B
options.text: Mechanical bonding between the stem and bone

options.label: C
options.text: Press fitting of the stem in the tight canal

options.label: D
options.text: Adhesion between the stem and bone due to adhesive properties of the stem

questions.correct_answer: A. Bone Ingrowth/ overgrowth over the surface of the stem
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The primary method of fixation in uncemented arthroplasty of the hip is through bone ingrowth or ongrowth over the surface of the prosthesis. This biological fixation provides a stable and durable attachment as opposed to cemented arthroplasty, which relies on the use of bone cement for immediate fixation.
  • ➤ The primary method of fixation in uncemented arthroplasty of the hip is through bone ingrowth or ongrowth over the surface of the prosthesis.
  • ➤ This biological fixation provides a stable and durable attachment as opposed to cemented arthroplasty, which relies on the use of bone cement for immediate fixation.

questions.text: A forensic expert is conducting an autopsy on an adult victim of suspected hanging. Examination of the neck is particularly focused on the hyoid bone, as fractures here can be indicative of the cause of death. In cases of hanging, where is a fracture of the hyoid bone most likely to be found?

options.label: A
options.text: Junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater cornu

options.label: B
options.text: Junction of the outer two-thirds and inner one-third of the greater cornu

questions.correct_answer: A. Junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater cornu
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The common anatomical site of hyoid bone fracture in cases of hanging, is most often at the junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater cornu.
  • ➤ The common anatomical site of hyoid bone fracture in cases of hanging, is most often at the junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater cornu.

questions.text: All are true regarding dystocia except:

options.label: B
options.text: It is the most common indication for primary csesarean delivery

options.label: C
options.text: The cervix should be atleast 2 cm dilated for diagnosis of dystocia

options.label: D
options.text: Dystocia can be due to abnormality in power, passage and passenger

questions.correct_answer: C. The cervix should be atleast 2 cm dilated for diagnosis of dystocia
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ACOG does not specify a cervical dilation of at least 2 cm for the diagnosis of dystocia. Instead, the diagnosis should be based on a comprehensive assessment of labor progress, taking into account the individual variability of labor patterns.
  • ➤ ACOG does not specify a cervical dilation of at least 2 cm for the diagnosis of dystocia.
  • ➤ Instead, the diagnosis should be based on a comprehensive assessment of labor progress, taking into account the individual variability of labor patterns.

questions.text: A 29-years-old pregnant female's routine investigations showed VDRL positive with 1:16 titres. TPHA was also positive. The pregnant female was adequately treated with injection benzathine penicillin. What is the next step of management for the baby?

options.label: A
options.text: Give injection aqueous penicillin to baby

options.label: B
options.text: Perform serum VDRL of the baby

options.label: C
options.text: Perform CSF VDRL of the baby

questions.correct_answer: B. Perform serum VDRL of the baby
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Perform serum VDRL of the baby

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a newborn with a risk of congenital syphilis, a serum VDRL should be performed to screen for the disease. If the test is positive or there are clinical signs suggestive of congenital syphilis, further treatment and investigations, including CSF analysis, are warranted to manage the condition appropriately.
  • ➤ In a newborn with a risk of congenital syphilis, a serum VDRL should be performed to screen for the disease.
  • ➤ If the test is positive or there are clinical signs suggestive of congenital syphilis, further treatment and investigations, including CSF analysis, are warranted to manage the condition appropriately.

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a skin condition that has been present for several months. She reports that whenever she scratches her skin, even lightly, she develops raised, red lines that are itchy and last for about 30 minutes to an hour. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Dermatographic urticaria

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The key feature of Dermatographic urticaria is the formation of raised, red lines on the skin in response to scratching, which typically resolve within an hour.
  • ➤ The key feature of Dermatographic urticaria is the formation of raised, red lines on the skin in response to scratching, which typically resolve within an hour.

questions.text: During a routine shift, a medical officer at a district hospital is called to examine four deceased individuals, each with different medical histories and causes of death. The officer notes the early onset of rigor mortis in three cases but needs to determine which condition typically does not lead to an early onset of rigor mortis. Which of the following conditions is NOT associated with early onset of rigor mortis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Pneumonia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rigor mortis (Latin, stiffness of death) is that state of the muscles in a dead body when they become stiff or rigid with some degree of shortening. Conditions like cholera, heat stroke, and OPC poisoning accelerate rigor mortis, while pneumonia does not, is crucial for forensic investigations to help estimate the time of death more accurately.
  • ➤ Rigor mortis (Latin, stiffness of death) is that state of the muscles in a dead body when they become stiff or rigid with some degree of shortening.
  • ➤ Conditions like cholera, heat stroke, and OPC poisoning accelerate rigor mortis, while pneumonia does not, is crucial for forensic investigations to help estimate the time of death more accurately.

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman with a history of previous right thyroidectomy for a benign thyroid nodule now undergoes completion thyroidectomy for a suspicious thyroid mass. Several hours postoperatively, she develops progressive stridor, and difficulty breathing. Orotracheal intubation is successful. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibre-optic laryngoscopy to rule out bilateral vocal cord paralysis

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Wound exploration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The clinical picture of post-operative wound hematoma causing tracheal compressing, requiring immediate wound exploration and removal of clot.
  • ➤ The clinical picture of post-operative wound hematoma causing tracheal compressing, requiring immediate wound exploration and removal of clot.

questions.text: A 42-year woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhoea. Pelvis ultrasound reveals an intramural fibroid measuring 3 cm. The woman desires medical management rather than surgical intervention. Which of the following would be the most appropriate 1 st line drug in this woman?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ In managing heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhea associated with uterine fibroids, the first-line medical treatment often includes antifibrinolytics, such as tranexamic acid, combined with NSAIDs. This approach aims to reduce menstrual blood loss and alleviate pain, offering an effective non-surgical option for symptom management.
  • ➤ In managing heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhea associated with uterine fibroids, the first-line medical treatment often includes antifibrinolytics, such as tranexamic acid, combined with NSAIDs.
  • ➤ This approach aims to reduce menstrual blood loss and alleviate pain, offering an effective non-surgical option for symptom management.

questions.text: In a 5-year-old child presenting with signs of sepsis and shock (BP 90/60 mm Hg, pulse rate 144/min, respiratory rate 30/min), which initial fluid management is most appropriate?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 20 mL/kg of 0.9% normal saline

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The initial management of pediatric shock involves rapid intravenous administration of isotonic fluids, such as 0.9% normal saline, at a dose of 20 mL/kg to restore intravascular volume and improve perfusion.
  • ➤ The initial management of pediatric shock involves rapid intravenous administration of isotonic fluids, such as 0.9% normal saline, at a dose of 20 mL/kg to restore intravascular volume and improve perfusion.

questions.text: A 29-year-old female presents to the dermatology clinic with several depigmented patches on her hands and face as shown in the image below. There were white hairs seen in the depigmented patches. These patches have progressively enlarged over the past year. Which of the following is the most likely cause for the depigmentation in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Absent melanocytes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitiligo is an autoimmune disorder characterized by progressive depigmentation of the skin due to the loss of melanocytes. The presence of white or depigmented hair within the patches is highly suggestive of vitiligo.
  • ➤ Vitiligo is an autoimmune disorder characterized by progressive depigmentation of the skin due to the loss of melanocytes.
  • ➤ The presence of white or depigmented hair within the patches is highly suggestive of vitiligo.

questions.text: While conducting laryngoscopy and intubation in a clinical skills examination, which of the following steps is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: A slight pressure may be applied at the cricoid cartilage to occlude the esophagus during rapid sequence induction.

options.label: B
options.text: After insertion of the laryngoscope, the blade is used to lift the tongue and soft tissues to visualize the vocal cords, without using teeth as a fulcrum.

options.label: C
options.text: The patient's neck should be positioned with flexion at the cervical spine and extension at the atlantooccipital joint, known as the 'sniffing position'.

options.label: D
options.text: The laryngoscope is usually held in the right hand and introduced from the right side of the patient’s mouth.

questions.correct_answer: D. The laryngoscope is usually held in the right hand and introduced from the right side of the patient’s mouth.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) The laryngoscope is usually held in the right hand and introduced from the right side of the patient’s mouth.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ It is important to recognize proper techniques during laryngoscopy and intubation, such as avoiding leveraging the laryngoscope on the patient's upper incisors, positioning the patient in the 'sniffing position', and holding the laryngoscope in the left hand while introducing it from the right side of the mouth.
  • ➤ It is important to recognize proper techniques during laryngoscopy and intubation, such as avoiding leveraging the laryngoscope on the patient's upper incisors, positioning the patient in the 'sniffing position', and holding the laryngoscope in the left hand while introducing it from the right side of the mouth.

questions.text: A 54-year-old man had noticed during the past 3 months a thickening of the skin at the base of his right ring finger, which tried to pull his finger towards palm. He consulted his physician. On examination of the palms of both hands, a localized thickening of subcutaneous tissue could be felt at the base of the right ring and little fingers. The metacarpophalangeal joint of the ring finger could not be fully extended, either actively or passively. Identify the incorrect statement:

options.label: B
options.text: Palmar Aponeurosis is thickening of Deep Fascia of Palm

options.label: C
options.text: Each slip is attached to the Base of the Middle Phalanx and to the Fibrous Flexor Sheath of each finger

options.label: D
options.text: The Palmar Aponeurosis distally it divides into Four Slips

questions.correct_answer: C. Each slip is attached to the Base of the Middle Phalanx and to the Fibrous Flexor Sheath of each finger
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Each slip is attached to the Base of the Middle Phalanx and to the Fibrous Flexor Sheath of each finger

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Each Slip is Attached to the Base of the Middle Phalanx and to the Fibrous Flexor Sheath of Each Finger:
  • ➤ Each Slip is Attached to the Base of the Middle Phalanx and to the Fibrous Flexor Sheath of Each Finger:
  • ➤ Each Slip is Attached to the Base of the Middle Phalanx and to the Fibrous Flexor Sheath of Each Finger:
  • ➤ In Dupuytren's contracture, the pathological changes occur in the palmar aponeurosis and related structures. However, the palmar aponeurosis does not normally attach to the base of the middle phalanx. Instead, it primarily attaches to the bases of the proximal phalanges and the overlying skin .
  • ➤ In Dupuytren's contracture, the pathological changes occur in the palmar aponeurosis and related structures.
  • ➤ pathological changes
  • ➤ palmar aponeurosis
  • ➤ However, the palmar aponeurosis does not normally attach to the base of the middle phalanx. Instead, it primarily attaches to the bases of the proximal phalanges and the overlying skin .
  • ➤ attaches
  • ➤ bases
  • ➤ proximal phalanges
  • ➤ overlying skin

questions.text: A 28-year-old man is admitted to the emergency department after ingesting a large quantity of an unknown substance in a suicide attempt. The medical team suspects poisoning and considers various detoxification methods. A forensic expert suggests charcoal hemoperfusion as a possible treatment. For which of the following poisonings is charcoal hemoperfusion most useful?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Barbiturates

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Charcoal hemoperfusion is particularly useful for removing lipophilic substances such as barbiturates from the bloodstream, which can be critical in managing acute poisoning cases effectively.
  • ➤ Charcoal hemoperfusion is particularly useful for removing lipophilic substances such as barbiturates from the bloodstream, which can be critical in managing acute poisoning cases effectively.

questions.text: A 25-year-old man presents to the clinic with a painless ulcer on his penis. He reports a history of contact with a commercial sex worker. A dark-field microscopy examination of the discharge from the lesion was performed, and the results are shown in the image. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Clue for diagnosis: Painless ulcer on penis, h/o contact with commercial sex worker, Dark ground microscopy showing spirally coiled bacilli à Suggestive of Treponema pallidum
  • ➤ Clue for diagnosis: Painless ulcer on penis, h/o contact with commercial sex worker, Dark ground microscopy showing spirally coiled bacilli à Suggestive of Treponema pallidum

questions.text: A pregnant woman arrives at the emergency department after suffering a stab wound to the right chest. She is extremely anxious and vocal. Vital signs show tachycardia and hypotension (90/60 mm Hg), with diminished breath sounds on the right and dullness on percussion. What should be the first step in her management?

options.label: B
options.text: Establish an intravenous line and begin saline infusion

options.label: C
options.text: Perform needle decompression on the right side of the chest

questions.correct_answer: B. Establish an intravenous line and begin saline infusion
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Establish an intravenous line and begin saline infusion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the setting of trauma with signs of decreased breath sounds, dullness and hypotension, the scenario suggests a massive hemothorax. In this case, IVF should be started to restore the hemodynamic status.
  • ➤ In the setting of trauma with signs of decreased breath sounds, dullness and hypotension, the scenario suggests a massive hemothorax. In this case, IVF should be started to restore the hemodynamic status.

questions.text: A 6-year-old child presents with fever, generalized weakness, weight loss, pancytopenia, and palpable lymph nodes. The peripheral smear is as given below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) ALL

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of lymphoblasts in the peripheral smear in a child with fever, pancytopenia, and lymphadenopathy is characteristic of acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).
  • ➤ The presence of lymphoblasts in the peripheral smear in a child with fever, pancytopenia, and lymphadenopathy is characteristic of acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).

questions.text: All of the following statements are incorrect about the pointed Area A in the given image except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is located on the dorsal aspect of hand and becomes visible when the thumb is fully abducted adducted

options.label: B
options.text: Floor is formed by styloid process of radius, base of first metacarpal bone

options.label: C
options.text: Medially by tendon of extensor pollicis brevis

options.label: D
options.text: Laterally by extensor carpi radialis longus

questions.correct_answer: B. Floor is formed by styloid process of radius, base of first metacarpal bone

Ans. B) Floor is formed by styloid process of radius, base of first metacarpal bone

  • ➤ Floor is formed by the styloid process of the radius and the base of the first metacarpal bone :
  • ➤ Floor is formed by the styloid process of the radius and the base of the first metacarpal bone
  • ➤ This statement is correct . From proximal to distal floor is formed by the styloid process of radius, scaphoid , trapezium and base of first metacarpal bone . Radial artery crosses the floor .

  • ➤ proximal
  • ➤ distal floor
  • ➤ styloid process
  • ➤ radius, scaphoid
  • ➤ trapezium
  • ➤ base of first metacarpal bone

questions.text: A 30-year-old lady presented to a physician with complaints of hematuria. Upon evaluation, red blood cells (RBCs) were found in the urine but no medical cause was identified. Further inquiry revealed that she has visited many doctors with the same complaints and would demand inpatient care. She would prick her finger and mix blood in the urine sample. What is her diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Factitious illness

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Factitious disorder is a condition where patients intentionally produce symptoms to assume the sick role, typically without external incentives, a crucial distinction for appropriate psychiatric referral and management
  • ➤ Factitious disorder is a condition where patients intentionally produce symptoms to assume the sick role, typically without external incentives, a crucial distinction for appropriate psychiatric referral and management

questions.text: A child is presenting defect in lower limbs as shown below likely has a metabolic defect impacting the urea cycle. Which enzyme deficiency should be suspected in this clinical scenario?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Arginase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Arginase deficiency causes hyperargininemia, typically presenting between ages 2 and 4 with spastic diplegia and increased levels of arginine, distinct from the early-onset hyperammonemia seen in other urea cycle disorders.
  • ➤ Arginase deficiency causes hyperargininemia, typically presenting between ages 2 and 4 with spastic diplegia and increased levels of arginine, distinct from the early-onset hyperammonemia seen in other urea cycle disorders.

questions.text: A 23-year-old female, manual labourer at a construction site, accidentally stepped over a sharp-edged blade in the site, following which there was severe bleeding from her sole. She was taken to a nearby hospital, where with much difficulty, the bleeding was arrested and cut ends were sutured. Which of the following statements pertaining to the above case is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood supply to sole is from branches of posterior tibial artery

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral plantar artery is the larger terminal branch and forms the plantar arterial arch

options.label: C
options.text: Plantar arterial arch will give rise to four plantar metatarsal arteries

options.label: D
options.text: Plantar arterial arch lies between the second & third layer of sole

questions.correct_answer: D. Plantar arterial arch lies between the second & third layer of sole
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Plantar arterial arch lies between the second & third layer of sole

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The plantar arterial arch lies deep to the tendons of the flexor digitorum brevis, which is in the second layer of the sole. It does not lie between the second and third layers but rather deep to the second layer.
  • ➤ The plantar arterial arch lies deep to the tendons of the flexor digitorum brevis, which is in the second layer of the sole. It does not lie between the second and third layers but rather deep to the second layer.

questions.text: A patient is emerging from anesthesia that included the use of nitrous oxide. To prevent a common post-anesthetic complication, which practice is typically followed by anesthesiologists?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer 100% oxygen to offset the second gas effect

options.label: B
options.text: Administer 100% oxygen to prevent diffusion hypoxia

options.label: C
options.text: Administer 100% oxygen to ensure adequate analgesia during recovery

options.label: D
options.text: Administer 100% oxygen because it is less expensive than air

questions.correct_answer: B. Administer 100% oxygen to prevent diffusion hypoxia
questions.explanation:
Ans. B). Administer 100% oxygen to prevent diffusion hypoxia.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Administering 100% oxygen after the use of nitrous oxide in anesthesia is essential to prevent diffusion hypoxia, a condition where the rapid diffusion of nitrous oxide out of the blood dilutes alveolar oxygen and leads to a decrease in available oxygen for the patient.
  • ➤ Administering 100% oxygen after the use of nitrous oxide in anesthesia is essential to prevent diffusion hypoxia, a condition where the rapid diffusion of nitrous oxide out of the blood dilutes alveolar oxygen and leads to a decrease in available oxygen for the patient.

questions.text: When evaluating the role of endotoxins in the pathogenesis of infections caused by Gram-negative bacteria, a group of researchers analyzes several species to determine which one's endotoxin does not contribute to the natural disease process. Which of the following Gram-negative bacteria is known for a pathogenesis in which the endotoxin plays no role?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Vibrio cholera

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vibrio cholerae's disease mechanism is primarily due to its exotoxin rather than its endotoxin is critical in comprehending the pathophysiology of cholera and the massive fluid loss it causes.
  • ➤ Vibrio cholerae's disease mechanism is primarily due to its exotoxin rather than its endotoxin is critical in comprehending the pathophysiology of cholera and the massive fluid loss it causes.

questions.text: A 33-year-old pregnant woman notices a persistent, painless lump in the left breast. On examination the left breast has a single mobile mass without evidence of skin changes or lymphadenopathy in the neck or axilla. An ultrasound demonstrates a solid, 1-cm mass in the upper outer quadrant of the breast. A core-needle biopsy shows invasive ductal carcinoma. The patient is in her first trimester of pregnancy. Which of the following is the most appropriate management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Termination of the pregnancy followed by modified radical mastectomy

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate administration of chemotherapy followed by modified radical mastectomy after delivery of the baby

options.label: C
options.text: Breast conservation therapy in third trimester

questions.explanation: Ans. D) Modified radical mastectomy

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman is diagnosed to have endometrial carcinoma on biopsy. She wishes to understand the high-risk factors for development of endometrial cancer. Which of the following is NOT a risk factor for development of endometrial carcinoma:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When discussing risk factors for endometrial carcinoma, it's important to recognize that multiparity is generally not associated with an increased risk of this type of cancer. In fact, having multiple pregnancies is often considered to be protective.
  • ➤ When discussing risk factors for endometrial carcinoma, it's important to recognize that multiparity is generally not associated with an increased risk of this type of cancer.
  • ➤ In fact, having multiple pregnancies is often considered to be protective.

questions.text: A 57-year-old female with severe Inflammatory Arthritis and on long term medications for treatment of Osteoporosis suddenly presented in emergency with pain in thigh with Inability to ambulate. X Rays were performed as below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The clinical presentation and radiographic features of an atypical femoral fracture, particularly in the context of a patient with osteoporosis undergoing long-term bisphosphonate therapy are characterized by specific radiographic features such as a transverse orientation, absence of comminution, and location in the subtrochanteric or diaphyseal region of the femur.
  • ➤ The clinical presentation and radiographic features of an atypical femoral fracture, particularly in the context of a patient with osteoporosis undergoing long-term bisphosphonate therapy are characterized by specific radiographic features such as a transverse orientation, absence of comminution, and location in the subtrochanteric or diaphyseal region of the femur.

questions.text: A third-year medical student is studying the anatomy of the hip joint for an upcoming exam. Which of the following ligaments is correctly paired with its primary function in stabilizing the hip joint?

options.label: A
options.text: Iliofemoral Ligament: Prevents Hyperextension of the Hip Joint

options.label: B
options.text: Ischiofemoral Ligament: Prevents Excessive Medial Rotation of the Hip Joint

options.label: C
options.text: Pubofemoral Ligament: Limits Abduction and External Rotation of the Hip Joint

options.label: D
options.text: Ligamentum Teres: Primary Stabilizer of the Hip Joint in all Movements

questions.correct_answer: A. Iliofemoral Ligament: Prevents Hyperextension of the Hip Joint
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Iliofemoral Ligament: Prevents Hyperextension of the Hip Joint

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iliofemoral ligament : This is the strongest ligament in the body and prevents hyperextension of the hip joint. It is located anteriorly and is often referred to as the Y-ligament of Bigelow .
  • ➤ Iliofemoral ligament : This is the strongest ligament in the body and prevents hyperextension of the hip joint.
  • ➤ Iliofemoral ligament
  • ➤ strongest ligament
  • ➤ body
  • ➤ hyperextension
  • ➤ It is located anteriorly and is often referred to as the Y-ligament of Bigelow .
  • ➤ anteriorly
  • ➤ Y-ligament
  • ➤ Bigelow
